definition: one step, one footprint (idiom); steady progress/reliable
pinyin: yi1 bu4 yi1 ge4 jiao3 yin4

definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
surname Bu
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
variant of 個|个[ge4]
individual/this/that/size/classifier for people or objects in general
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
variant of 角[jue2]/role
surname Yin/abbr. for 印度[Yin4 du4]
to print/to mark/to engrave/a seal/a print/a stamp/a mark/a trace/image

sentences.english: You start at the bottom and you work your way to the top.
sentences.chinese: 你要从底层做起，一步一个脚印走向成功的顶峰。

sentences.english: One step at a time, business integrity is a business growth of the Big Dipper .
sentences.chinese: 一步一个脚印，商业诚信是企业成长的北斗星。

definition: to have one's feet firmly planted on the ground (idiom); realistic without flights of fancy/steady and serious character
steady/steadfast
firm/solid/reliable/real/practical
to go steady and strike hard (in fighting)/fig. steadily and surely
great effort/to strive/to try hard
lit. a thousand mile journey begins with the first step/fig. big accomplishments come from an accumulation of little achievements made one by one
pinyin: qian1 li3 zhi1 xing2 , shi3 yu2 zu2 xia4

definition: to persevere unremittingly (idiom); to keep going until the end
lit. to have accumulated knowledge and deliver it slowly (idiom)/good preparation is the key to success/to be well prepared
to guard against pride and impatience (idiom); to remain modest and keep cool
firmly-based/steady/steadfast/to have peace of mind/free from anxiety/Taiwan pr. [ta4 shi2]
to pursue unremittingly (idiom); to persevere
lit. to cut one's way through thistles and thorns (idiom)/fig. to overcome all obstacles on the way/to break through hardships/to blaze a new trail
to advance gradually and entrench oneself at every step/to consolidate at every step
industrious and conscientious/assiduous
untiring/unremitting/indefatigable
see 磨練|磨练[mo2 lian4]
